ArticleTitle.sentence: cDNA cloning of a NGFI-B/nur77-related transcription factor from an apoptotic human T cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: A human T lymphoid cell line, PEER, dies by apoptosis in the presence of PMA and calcium ionophore.

event.clue: A human T lymphoid cell line, PEER, dies by apoptosis in the presence of PMA and calcium ionophore.
A human T lymphoid cell line, PEER, dies by apoptosis in the presence of PMA and calcium ionophore.
A human T lymphoid cell line, PEER, dies by apoptosis in the presence of PMA and calcium ionophore.

AbstractText.sentence: A new gene, TINUR, was cloned from apoptotic PEER cells.
The expression of the TINUR gene is induced within 1 h after the cross-linking of the T cell Ag receptor complex.

event.clue: The expression of the TINUR gene is induced within 1 h after the cross-linking of the T cell Ag receptor complex.
The expression of the TINUR gene is induced within 1 h after the cross-linking of the T cell Ag receptor complex.
The expression of the TINUR gene is induced within 1 h after the cross-linking of the T cell Ag receptor complex.

AbstractText.sentence: TINUR belongs to the NGFI-B/nur77 family of the steroid receptor superfamily and is an orphan receptor.
TINUR binds to the same DNA sequence as NGFI-B/nur77.

event.clue: TINUR binds to the same DNA sequence as NGFI-B/nur77.

AbstractText.sentence: We also propose that the NGFI-B/nur77 family can be classified into two subtypes.
